cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles west of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast, then forecast to bend west-northwest across southern Louisiana and into east-southeast Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (near or just west of the Mississippi River delta)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Sabine Pass TX eastward to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lakes Pontchartrain, Maurepas and Borgne, and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the Texas/Louisiana border eastward through Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–50 mph with higher gusts) are possible at/near Beaumont as Marco drifts inland across Louisiana into east Texas.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level is possible along Sabine Pass and the lower Neches River waterway affecting Beaumont’s approaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain with locally higher totals could cause flash and urban flooding in the Beaumont–Port Arthur area Tuesday into Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered power outages, localized river rises and reduced visibility; prolonged periods of heavy rain may disrupt terminal and roadway access.
